static const std::string & GetSdCardPath ()
 This function will deliver the path to the sdcard of the device. This shouldn't be used for saving or getting resources in actual builds, as anything saved on this path will not be deleted after the user uninstalls the application.
static const std::string & GetObbFolderPath ()
 This function will deliver the path to the obb folder of your application. Here the GEF enabled games will find the obb resources.
static const std::string & GetDataFolderPath ()
 This function will deliver the path to the data folder of your application. The data folder is the normal place to keep game data, if not using GEF. The data folder gets cleared if the user clears the data from the settings.
static const std::string & GetSaveFolderPath ()
 This function will deliver the path to the private folder of your application. Here is the best place to keep your save files. Other applications cannot access this folder.
static const std::string & GetCacheFolderPath ()
 This function will deliver the path to the cache folder of your application. This folder is good to keep small files, for a temporary time, like a temporary downloaded config.

Detailed Description

PackageUtils is the main Android OS API class. It is composed of getters for different identifiers and of minor implementations, like closing the application, or saving values in the application local space.

Member Function Documentation

static void acp_utils::api::PackageUtils::CloseLogo ( )
static

This function will close any logo previously displayed with ShowLogo. It will be a no-op if ShowLogo wasn’t previously called, but will trigger a log error in output.

Note
[Java call]
See Also
ShowLogo
static void acp_utils::api::PackageUtils::DeleteFile ( const char *  path)
static

Deletes a file from the filesystem.

Note
[Java call]
See Also
GetMetaDataValue
RemoveDirectoryRecursively
Parameters
path[in] The path towards the file to be deleted
static void acp_utils::api::PackageUtils::DisableUserLocation ( )
static

This function allows the game to start listening for location changes.

Note
[Java call]

The function allows the game to stop listening for location changes. Must be followed by a call to GetUserLocation() to retrieve the actual location of the user.

Attention
The default status for the location is "disabled".
static void acp_utils::api::PackageUtils::EnableUserLocation ( )
static

This function allows the game to start listening for location changes.

Note
[Java call]
See Also
GetUserLocation()

The function allows the game to start listening for location changes. Must be followed by a call to GetUserLocation() to retrieve the actual location of the user.

Attention
The default status for the location is "disabled".
static void acp_utils::api::PackageUtils::ExitApplication ( bool  restart = false)
static

This function will kill the application, with an optional flag for restarting the application.

Note
[Java call]
See Also
MinimizeApplication
Parameters
restart[in][optional] When specified, true will restart the application, false will close the application.

static const std::string& acp_utils::api::PackageUtils::GetAndroidId ( )
static

This function will return the android id of the device.

This function shouldn’t be necessary for game teams. It is exposed mostly for lib usage.

Note
[Native C++ call]
Returns
The Android ID associated with the device. Example of return value: "781ae4961b5ab46"
static std::vector<char> acp_utils::api::PackageUtils::GetAssetResource ( const std::string &  path)
static

This function will retrieve a resource from the asset folder in the apk.

Note
[Java call]
Attention
The function is slower then normal sdcard access and should be used mostly for retrieving a config file stored in the apk.
Parameters
name[in] The full name of the resource, example "events.json"
Returns
A raw byte array containing the resource requested. (char is signed on Android if -fsigned-char flag is active)

Note

See Also

GetIsACCharging()
GetBatteryStatus()
Returns
This will return the percentage of the battery. It will take int values between [0, 100]

static const std::string& acp_utils::api::PackageUtils::GetCacheFolderPath ( )
static

This function will deliver the path to the cache folder of your application. This folder is good to keep small files, for a temporary time, like a temporary downloaded config.

Folder can only be accessed by users or other applications then the calling app only with routed access

Note
[Native C++ call]
Attention
In extreme situations, the OS can decide to clear this folder, if the application is not in foreground. The user can also manually delete an application cache and delete the content of this folder.
Returns
The path to the cache folder. Example of return value: /data/data/com.gameloft.android.ANMP.GloftCNRL/cache
static const std::string& acp_utils::api::PackageUtils::GetCarrierName ( )
static

This function will return the carrier name for a device connected to a GSM network.

Note
[Native C++ call]
Returns
The carrier name if a carrier exists, or an empty string.
static jclass acp_utils::api::PackageUtils::GetClass ( std::string  i_class)
static

This function will return a jclass object, pointing to a java class set in class_list.inl.

Note
[Native C++ call]

Make sure the class you are trying to retrieve has been prior added to the class_list.inl. Otherwise, AF will report an error in output, and the return will be null.

Parameters
i_class[in] The jclass name, identical to how is declared in class_list.inl
Returns
the jclass requested, or NULL if the class was not declared in class_list.inl, or it is not found in the jclasses loaded by AF
static acp_utils::helpers::ConnectionType acp_utils::api::PackageUtils::GetConnectionType ( )
static

This function will return the internet state, in Connection Type.

Note
[Native C++ call]
See Also
acp_utils::helpers::ConnectionType (eNoConnectivity, eConnectivityWifi, eConnectivityBlueTooth, eConnectivityDummy, eConnectivityEthernet, eConnectivityWimax, eConnectivity2g, eConnectivity3g, eConnectivity4g, eConnectivityUnknown)
Returns
the ConnectionType
static const std::string& acp_utils::api::PackageUtils::GetCountry ( )
static

The country associated with the device.

This function will return the country, based on SIM, and has a fallback on the Locale parameter for users without SIM.

Note
[Native C++ call]
Returns
The country associated with the device. Example of return value: "US"
static const std::string& acp_utils::api::PackageUtils::GetCPUSerial ( )
static

This function will return the CPU serial number of the device.

This function shouldn’t be necessary for game teams. It is exposed mostly for lib usage.

Note
[Native C++ call]
Returns
The CPU Serial No. In some cases, it is identical to GetSerial, only in low-caps. On some devices, the CPU serial might come empty. Example of return value: “0146bf511501a004”. For all intents and purposes, use GetSerial() instead.
static float acp_utils::api::PackageUtils::GetCurrentAvailableRamInMegaBytes ( )
static

This function will return the current RAM available on the device in Mega Bytes.

Note
[Native C++ call]
Returns
The currently available value of MB of RAM reported by the device. Used for profile detection. Example of return value: 128.57
static int acp_utils::api::PackageUtils::GetCurrentCpuSpeedInHz ( )
static

This function will return the current CPU speed in the first core (cpu0)

Note
[Native C++ call]
Attention
The CPU speed can fluctuate. For max cpu, use GetMaxCpuSpeedInHz
See Also
GetMaxCpuSpeedInHz()
Returns
The current CPU speed for the first core, in Hz. Example of return value: 1200000
static const std::string& acp_utils::api::PackageUtils::GetDataFolderPath ( )
static

This function will deliver the path to the data folder of your application. The data folder is the normal place to keep game data, if not using GEF. The data folder gets cleared if the user clears the data from the settings.

Note
[Native C++ call]
Returns
The path to the data folder. Example of return value: /storage/emulated/0/Android/data/com.gameloft.android.ANMP.GloftCNRL/files
static const std::string& acp_utils::api::PackageUtils::GetDefaultIGP ( )
static

This function will return the default IGP code. Used for HEP builds, when injecting a new IGP, to keep track of both the default IGP and the injected IGP.

Note
[Native C++ call]
Requirement:
Requires USE_HEP_EXT_IGPINFO define active.
Returns
The default IGP value, or an empty string if USE_HEP_EXT_IGPINFO not enabled.

static const acp_utils::helpers::GAIDStatus acp_utils::api::PackageUtils::GetGoogleAdIdStatus ( )
static

This function can be queried to find out the current status of GoogleAdId status. The Google AdId can be in unretrieved state when launching the application.

This function shouldn’t be necessary for game teams. It is exposed mostly for lib usage.

Note
[Native C++ call]
See Also
acp_utils::helpers::GAIDStatus
Returns
An acp_utils::helpers::GAIDStatus object that reflects the current status of the Google AdId status
static const std::string& acp_utils::api::PackageUtils::GetHDIDFVStr ( )
static

This function will return the HDIDFV string. HDIDFV is Gameloft's unique identifier, softawre generated.

Note
[Native C++ call]
Returns
The HDIDFV for the current device. Example of return value: “67b0c7f4-14a7-49de-86b6-37126d489c09”

static const std::string& acp_utils::api::PackageUtils::GetIMEI ( )
static

This function will return the IMEI number, as reported by the OS API.

Note
[Native C++ call]
Requirement:
Requires READ_PHONE_STATE permission.
Attention
Permission required is not accepted on Google Play and Amazon Store. The permission is permitted on other shops.
Deprecated:
As the permission is banned by Google, the standard identifier is HDIDFV.
See Also
GetHDIDFVStr()
Returns
The IMEI of the device, if available. In case the device doesn’t have a SIM, or READ_PHONE_STATE isn’t enable, the function will return an empty string. Example of return value: “358350040453612”

static

This function will return the injected IGP code. Used for HEP builds when injecting a new IGP.

Note
[Native C++ call]
Requirement:
Requires USE_HEP_EXT_IGPINFO define active.
Returns
The injected IGP code, or an empty string if USE_HEP_EXT_IGPINFO not enabled.

static const bool acp_utils::api::PackageUtils::GetIsACCharging ( )
static

This function will return a cached value set by the battery state listaner, stating if the battery is charging from an AC adapter.

Note
[Native C++ call]
See Also
GetIsBatteryCharging()
GetIsUsbCharging()
Returns
If the device is charging via AC adapter, the call will return true. If the device is charging via other means, or not charging at all, it will return false.
static const bool acp_utils::api::PackageUtils::GetIsBatteryCharging ( )
static

This function will return a cached value set by the battery state listaner, stating if the battery is charging or not.

Note
[Native C++ call]
See Also
GetIsUsbCharging()
GetIsACCharging()
GetBatteryStatus()
Returns
True if the device is currently being charged. False if it is not.
static const bool acp_utils::api::PackageUtils::GetIsUsbCharging ( )
static

This function will return a cached value set by the battery state listaner, stating if the battery is charging from a USB charger.

Note
[Native C++ call]
See Also
GetIsBatteryCharging()
GetIsACCharging()
Returns
If the device is charging via USB connection (from a PC), this will return true. If the device is charging via charger, or not charging at all, it will return false.

This function will return the JavaVM object.

the Java VM object used for JNI operations.

Returns
The Wi-Fi MAC address. Example: “a0:0b:ba:b4:d7:58”

static std::string acp_utils::api::PackageUtils::GetMetaDataValue ( const std::string &  key)
static

This function provides the user to access meta data values declared in the android manifest.

Note
[Java call]
Attention
The function will retrieve the value from a meta tag declared in the manifest, following the meta-data format: http://developer.android.com/guide/topics/manifest/meta-data-element.html
Parameters
namekey [in] The key associated with the android:name from the mata-data
static void* acp_utils::api::PackageUtils::GetNativeWindow ( )
static

This function will return a void pointer, that can be converted to ANativeWindow*. It can also return null if no SurfaceView is active in Java.

Note
[Native C++ call]

Function that is used from ANativeWindow*. This call is mostly handled by the entry point in game engines. Games shouldn't require it explicitly.

Returns
the SurfaceView last sent from Java. This object can be converted to ANativeWindow*.
static int acp_utils::api::PackageUtils::GetNumberOfCpuCores ( )
static

This function will return the number of usable CPU cores in the OS, no matter if they are active or not.

Note
[Native C++ call]
Returns
The number of CPU cores.
static const std::string& acp_utils::api::PackageUtils::GetObbFolderPath ( )
static

This function will deliver the path to the obb folder of your application. Here the GEF enabled games will find the obb resources.

Note
[Native C++ call]
Returns
The path to the obb folder. Example of return value: /storage/emulated/0/Android/obb/com.gameloft.android.ANMP.GloftCNRL
static const std::string& acp_utils::api::PackageUtils::GetSaveFolderPath ( )
static

This function will deliver the path to the private folder of your application. Here is the best place to keep your save files. Other applications cannot access this folder.

Folder can only be accessed by users or other applications then the calling app only with routed access

Note
[Native C++ call]
Returns
The path to the save folder. Example of return value: /data/data/com.gameloft.android.ANMP.GloftCNRL/files
static const std::string& acp_utils::api::PackageUtils::GetSdCardPath ( )
static

This function will deliver the path to the sdcard of the device. This shouldn't be used for saving or getting resources in actual builds, as anything saved on this path will not be deleted after the user uninstalls the application.

Note
[Native C++ call]
Deprecated:
This function requires ACCESS_EXTERNAL_STORAGE permission, which is hinted by Google to be banned in the future.
Returns
The path to the sdcard. Example of return value: /storage/emulated/0

This function shouldn’t be necessary for game teams. It is exposed mostly for lib usage.

static bool acp_utils::api::PackageUtils::IsVideoCompleted ( )

[Java call]

LaunchVideoPlayer

static void acp_utils::api::PackageUtils::Jni_CheckForExceptions ( )
static

This function will check for any pending exceptions in JNI.

Note
[Native C++ call]

It is more of use when debugging a weird crash related to JNI, and shouldn't be included in the final version of the code.

The call to the function itself will also clear any JNI exception after showing it, so JNI calls will continue to function correctly after this call, even if previous to CheckForException call correct JNI calls were crashing.

static bool acp_utils::api::PackageUtils::LaunchBrowser ( const char *  url)
static

This function will open a browser with the exact url mentioned.

Note
[Java call]
[Starts a webview]
[Triggers an interrupt]

The browser will open in the main UI thread, not in the calling thread. Warning! Not to be confused with the LanchBrowser from InGameBrowser, which relates to the redirects from ingameads URLs.

Parameters
url[in] The full URL path for the browser.
Returns
True for success, false for failure.
static bool acp_utils::api::PackageUtils::LaunchVideoPlayer ( const char *  filename)
static

This function will open a video from a file located in the asset folder from the apk.

Note
[Java call]
[Starts a new Activity]
[Triggers an interrupt]
Requirement:
Requires USE_VIDEO_PLAYER define active.
Parameters
filename[in] The asset name, located in the assets folder from the apk.
Returns
True for success, false for failure if the video player will launch.
static void acp_utils::api::PackageUtils::MinimizeApplication ( )
static

This function will send your application to background, initiating a normal interrupt flow.

Note
[Java call]
See Also
ExitApplication

It should be used for special cases, like when pressing back button during the first logo screen (according to QA checklist, the application should be minimized).

static void acp_utils::api::PackageUtils::ShowCannotGoBack ( )
static

This function will display a system pop - up with the message “You cannot go back at this stage”.

Note
[Java call]

The pop-up will be localized in the device language, as it is a system pop-up.

static void acp_utils::api::PackageUtils::ShowLogo ( const int &  resId)
static

This function will display a picture present in the apk resource raw folder, overlaying your game.

Note
[Java call]

You will have to specify the resId (which is associated with the R.java resource IDs). If a resId bellow 0 is specified, the implementation will assume a Gameloft logo exists with the name gameloft_logo in your raw folder, and try to display it. Calling this function will not call an interrupt (onPause) in your game, and code execution will continue in game-specific code. The logo will start displaying from the main UI thread, not from the calling thread, so the call isn’t blocking.

See Also
CloseLogo
static void acp_utils::api::PackageUtils::ShowWelcomeScreen ( acp_utils::helpers::Language  lang)
static

This function will open the welcome screen.

Note
[Java call]
[Starts a new Activity]
[Triggers an interrupt]
Requirement:
Requires a callback implementation. Check GameFunctionsToImplement.h
Requirement:
Requires USE_WELCOME_SCREEN define active.

This function is usefull for non-CRM shops. For CRM Welcome Screens use Online Libs (Gaia, Glot).

See Also
acp_utils::helpers::Language
splashScreenFunc

Refer to the Welcome Screen for more documentation on implementation guidelines. The Welcome Screen will be launched from the main UI thread, not from the calling thread.

The Language enum matches the Android Core Package format, so game-specific translations between game-specific language to acp-specific language enum should be performed. Once the Welcome Screen is closed, the callback will be received in splashScreenFunc(const char*), so make sure you implement such a function. The same naming convention is used for iOS, so you should have the game-specific code from iOS.

Parameters
lang[in] The language recognized in which the Welcome Screen will displayed, in Android Core Package recognizable format.
Generated on Mon Apr 20 2015 18:12:54 for Android Framework by   1.8.1.2
